definition: one year period (in a contract or budget)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: For example, the cost of a one-year insurance policy paid in advance is a prepaid expense.
sentences.chinese: 今後要支付的一年期保險單就是一種預提費用。

sentences.english: The one-year contract begins October 1 and has four one-year options.
sentences.chinese: 一年期合同開始於10月1日，並有四個一年選擇。

sentences.english: For example, the cost of a one-year i urance policy paid in advance is a prepaid expe e.
sentences.chinese: 今後要支付的一年期保險單就是一種預提費用。

definition: certificate of deposit/time deposit/abbr. for 定期存款|定期存款[ding4 qi1 cun2 kuan3]
closing date (of contract)/maturity (of an investment bond)
to fall due (loan etc)/to expire (visa etc)/to mature (investment bond etc)
